data.sentence: The word وَهُوَ comes from the root ه و and is associated with the meanings: huwa = He (pronoun. masculine 3rd. sing.)
The word سَقِيمٌ comes from the root س ق م and is associated with the meanings: to be ill/sick/weak, not well.

data.meanings: (Nun-Ba-Thal) to throw, fling, give up, cast off, reject, throw a thing because of its worthlessness or not taking into account.
data.sentence: The word فَنَبَذْنَاهُ comes from the root ن ب ذ and is associated with the meanings: (Nun-Ba-Thal) to throw, fling, give up, cast off, reject, throw a thing because of its worthlessness or not taking into account.

data.meanings: to become naked, denude of (garments). ara - bare desert or place, open field, waste land, shore.
data.sentence: The word بِالْعَرَاءِ comes from the root ع ر ي and is associated with the meanings: to become naked, denude of (garments). ara - bare desert or place, open field, waste land, shore.
